stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds the new Wild-West level for Return to Yoshi’s Island, focusing on modelling a functioning train and giving a guided tour of every planned building and gameplay hook.

development_findings.summary: Core layout finished: sheriff’s office, hat store, random houses, big-iron gun shop, hotel, bank, unagi-oil stall, saloon, tumbleweed shop, cactus garden, chain-chomp pen and looping train tracks.
development_findings.quote: I made some insane progress over the week… let me give you a rundown of the buildings.

development_findings.summary: Gameplay loop: Mario hunts three outlaws (a five-Goomba gang, a Snifit and a Shy Guy), jails them in the sheriff’s office and can talk to them afterwards.
Train design: low-poly engine (≈182 triangles) with at least one car, 3-D wheels, working head-light and ‘64’ logo; will circle the map every ~10 seconds so players can jump on it.
development_findings.quote: I think I want just the choo-choo train and then you can just jump on it.

development_findings.summary: Art direction: hybrid of Mario Kart 64’s Calamari Desert train and the crisper Mario Kart 7 model; MK7 textures selectively down-res’d to fit hack’s style.
development_findings.quote: I feel like I should get an in-between of the both.

development_findings.summary: Object work: two kickable tumbleweeds (spawn times will be offset, need shadows) plus a gag shop where Mario can ‘buy’ one.
development_findings.quote: You can even kick them… we should make it so you can buy a tumbleweed at the tumbleweed store.

development_findings.summary: Performance feature: the ROM checks for emulator; on emulator draw distance becomes unlimited and frame-rate defaults to 60 FPS (vs 30 FPS on console).
development_findings.quote: I’m making it so that on emulator drawing distances are unlimited … and it defaults to 60 fps instead of 30.

development_findings.summary: Current build runs 40-50 FPS on real hardware before optimisation.
development_findings.quote: This level ran pretty stable, 40 to 50 fps … and we haven’t even optimized it yet.

development_findings.summary: Collision baking still pending; train movement can’t be coded until tracks are final— present UV glitch shows need for another bake.
development_findings.quote: We can’t program the train yet because we need the collision baked for that.

development_findings.summary: Textures will be CI4 wherever possible to save memory; Biobak will polish the ‘64’ logo texture that Kaze mocked up in Photoshop.
Cultural choice: no Native-American caricatures; level is an over-the-top cowboy pastiche instead.
development_findings.quote: We’re just making cowboys … no reason to have random political controversy.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is ‘all-in’ on the theme—only watches cowboy TV shows (e.g., Westworld) while working to stay in mood.
context_findings.quote: My dedication to the cowboy theme is still big, I started only watching cowboy TV shows while working on this.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with YouTube algorithm: believes his latest technical video is strong but initial views are poor; predicts delayed success.
context_findings.quote: Right now it’s doing poorly, but in 24 hours it’s going to do insanely well.

context_findings.summary: Personal stance: wants to raise the ROM-hacking skill ceiling, not the floor; won’t cripple his code for others’ convenience.
context_findings.quote: I don’t really care about raising the skill floor, I care about raising the skill ceiling.

context_findings.summary: Self-image: attributes perceived development ‘craziness’ to himself, not the N64 hardware.
context_findings.quote: No, it’s not the N64 development that’s crazy. It’s just me. I am the crazy one.

biobak.summary: Spotted mis-aligned vertices on decorative balls and suggested raising metal track parts; Kaze adjusted geometry immediately.
Will redo the 64 logo texture because Kaze’s Photoshop attempt ‘looks like McDonald’s’.
biobak.quote: Do not worry, he will make it better later.

zeina.summary: Appeared briefly in chat discussing Christmas presents; no project input this stream.

key_stories.title: Calamari Train Re-imagined
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a moving train that suits the hack’s art style. He browses MK64 and MK7 assets, debates using a rip, then hand-models a hybrid low-poly engine and scales it in-game.
key_stories.challenge: Finding a train model that matches the hack’s look without clashing with N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Examined reference models, imported MK7 textures, hand-built a 182-triangle engine, added 3-D wheels and a 64 logo, repeatedly resized and tested in-game.
key_stories.outcome: Finished visual model approved on stream; movement will be coded after collision bake.
key_stories.key_quote: Let’s enjoy this for a bit … that’s a beautiful train.

key_stories.title: Emulator-Aware Performance Boost
key_stories.summary: Kaze explains a new system that detects emulators and automatically lifts draw-distance caps and doubles frame-rate.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing visual fidelity on emulator with strict console limits.
key_stories.process: Implemented an environment check in code; set separate defaults for FPS and clipping planes.
key_stories.outcome: Feature works; players on emulator get 60 FPS and unlimited draw distance while hardware keeps 30 FPS.
key_stories.key_quote: I do actually check if the game is running on emulator … drawing distances are unlimited.

open_questions.context: Visual model is done, but coding awaits collision baking; Kaze didn’t outline how the engine will loop, handle timing or interaction.
questions: How will the train’s movement and collision be implemented on N64 hardware?
Will the player be able to drive or alter the train’s route?
What optimisation tricks will keep the moving multi-segment object within performance budgets?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned jailing three outlaws but didn’t explain mission structure, rewards or fail states.
questions: What triggers the bounty hunts and how are they integrated into star objectives?
Will jailed enemies influence dialogue or later levels?
Is there a boss or climax for the level besides the train?

open_questions.context: He described arriving ‘post-robbery’ but said interior may not be accessible.
questions: Will players ever enter the bank or is the story told through environmental cues?
Any minigame or puzzle planned around the stolen bullion props?

open_questions.context: Biobak’s tasks are visible, but composer Badub and animator Zeina weren’t involved this stream.
questions: What music style is Badub composing for the Western level?
What animations (e.g., Goomba gang trench-coat, tumbleweed interactions) is Zeina working on?

open_questions.context: Kaze confirmed the feature exists but not how it works.
questions: What technical method is used to detect emulator vs real N64?

open_questions.context: He hinted at vacation work but gave no schedule.
questions: What milestone schedule is planned for Return to Yoshi’s Island?
